results.title: The Big Sleep
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Raymond Chandler’s novel of the same name, “The Big Sleep” stars Humphrey Bogart as Philip Marlowe, the private eye who “dares to walk the mean streets alone”. Investigating a series of gambling debts he comes across plenty of murder, blackmail, kidnapping and violence. Lauren Bacall plays opposite Bogart and the screen magic between them in this film is legendary. The witty dialogue is scripted by William Faulkner. A consummate Hollywood film noir.

results.title: The Big picture: conservation treatment of a large painting
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart, Department of Home Affairs and Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre
results.brief_description: Conservators, Allan Byrne and Tom Dixon, discuss the restoration of the huge oil paint by Tom Roberts entitled “The Opening of the First Parliament of the Australian Commonwealth by His Majesty King George V (when Duke of York). 9th May 1901”. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels and tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: The Big one
results.creator_credit: Michael Moore, Kathleen Glynn, Dog Eat Dog Films, BBC, Mayfair Entertainment International and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Michael Moore, this is a documentary account of Moore travelling across America to promote his most recent book “Downsize this: random threats from an unarmed American”. Moore, unbeknown to the book’s publishers, gathers a film crew to follow him as he gives public lectures, signs books and gives surprise visits to large corporations. Moore challenges some executives at large companies asking why they are ‘downsizing’ staff in a time of record profits. He visits not only large cities but also some small towns - including one town that was listed as the worst in America. He talks to workers and townsfolk who are trying to live on minimum wage and those who have not had pay increases in many, many years. Large factories are closing down across America as companies use cheaper overseas labour in their manufacturing processes. Only one CEO agrees to an interview, the head of Nike, and he does not provide Michael with a happy ending to his film - Nike shoes are not manufactured in America and are made by teenage workers in Indonesia (minimum age of 14) - something the CEO has no problem with. Using his unique mix of humour, compassion and outright brashness, Moore has created a glimpse into the social and political climate in America in the late 1990s.

results.title: The Big Lebowski
results.creator_credit: Joel Coen, Ethan Coen and PolyGram Filmed Entertainment
results.brief_description: The plot of this Raymond Chandleresque comedy-drama crime caper from the Coen Brothers pivots around a case of mistaken identity. Unemployed and laid-back, 70s refugee Jeff “The Dude” Lebowski likes hanging out with his friends and bowling. His life takes an alternate route when two thugs break into his home and soil his rug in the belief that they are accosting Jeff Lebowski, the Pasadena millionaire. The Dude looks up his wealthy namesake and manages to get a replacement for his soiled rug, but he also manages to embroil himself in a story of extortion, double-cross, deception, embezzlement, sex and dope. Cast includes Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Julianne Moore, Steve Buscemi, Ben Gazzara and John Turturro.

results.title: The Big island [Cinemascope print]
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The aim of this film is to show an international audience within a limited time span some attractive aspects of Australian life. Representing Australia as a brisk and exciting place and creating a mood of a young country on the mood. Cinematography by Keith Gow and Don McAlpine. Music by George Dreyfus. (Awards: AFI Travel Award 1970)

results.title: The Big dig
results.creator_credit: Marje Aleck and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Follows a team of archaeologists and students working on the Gezer archaeological expedition as they explore the remains of the city of Gezer in ancient Philistia, now in Israel. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: The Big combo
results.creator_credit: Joseph Lewis, Sidney Harmon and Allied Artists Pictures
results.brief_description: This is not just another gangster movie, but far more a private obsessional duel, a battle of wills between a smooth-tongued gangster and a fixated cop, which is resolved in terms of individual foibles and motivations. The film deals with a new brand of corporate business-minded gangster. The film’s two main characters (Leonard Diamond and Mr. Brown) run along parallel lines: both are haunted by chimeras of innocence, they are both aggressive in the pursuit of their differing ambitions. Stars Cornel Wilde, Richard Conte, Brian Donlevy, Jean Wallace.

results.title: Grandma Jessie
results.brief_description: In this very personal story, Stephanie King pays tribute to her Grandma Jessie and reflects on the influence her upbringing by her grandmother has had on her own education and outlook.

results.title: The Big circus
results.creator_credit: Joseph Newman, Irwin Allen and Allied Artists Pictures
results.brief_description: Victor Mature plays circus owner, Hank Whirling, an autocratic boss whose business is under threat of closure from changes to the entertainment industry and a saboteur whose work threatens lives as well as business. After borrowing heavily to keep the circus afloat Whirling is burdened with the presence of bank officer Randy Sherman and publicist Helen Harrison. Moving with the times is not one of Whirling’s strong points and he takes exception to having a female press agent. In a bid to boost dwindling sales Whirling reluctantly agrees to allow Zack Colino, his top aerialist, to perform a media attention grabbing feat - crossing Niagara Falls on a tight rope. Humour, comedy and colour pervade the film that constitutes good-natured family fun, as well as consisting of some stunning stunts. Originally filmed in cinemascope, “The Big circus” features a star cast including Vincent Price, Peter Lorre and Red Buttons. This film was to be one of Mature’s last leading men roles. Producer Allen Irwin, also co-wrote the screenplay with some-time Hitchcock collaborator Charles Bennet.

results.title: The Big blue
results.creator_credit: Luc Besson, Patrice Ledoux and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is the poignant story of Jacques Mayol (Jean-Marc Barr), a free diving champion who must choose between his passion for the sea and his love of a New York businesswoman (Rosanna Arquette). His mettle as a human being is tested when he finds he must choose between two vastly different lifestyles. One with the passionate woman in one of the worlds largest cities and the other in a small village close to the sea which has always been his life. An extraordinarily beautiful film set against spectacular backdrops in Sicily, Paris, New York and the Greek Isles.
